question.title: Guideline for method ordering
question.body:
What's the best practice, preferably backed by a publicly available guideline issued by a tech company or a standards organization, when it comes to the order of method declarations in a Java source file?

In particular, I'm interested in which should go first: private methods invoked from a constructor or public methods. One the one hand, it is advised, e.g. in Clean Code, to declare methods right after the first method from which it is first invoked.

In general we want function call dependencies to point in the downward direction. That is, a function that is called should be below a function that does the calling. This creates a nice flow down the source code module from high level to low level.

Clean Code. Chapter 5, "Formatting".

On the other hand, some say public methods should be declared first since one should be able to tell what a class does (not how it does it) at first glance at the source file. If a class is a GUI component, for example, initialization logic may be contained in a big number of private methods (e.g. createContentPane(), createSubmitButton()) which would pull any of its public methods way down if the latter have a lower priority.

You may cite several guidelines if you wish.

I haven't found it in Google Java Style Guide, it just opts out.

The order you choose for the members and initializers of your class can have a great effect on learnability. However, there's no single correct recipe for how to do it; different classes may order their contents in different ways.

What is important is that each class uses some logical order, which its maintainer could explain if asked.

Oracle's Code Conventions are also not very specific.

These methods should be grouped by functionality rather than by scope or accessibility. For example, a private class method can be in between two public instance methods. The goal is to make reading and understanding the code easier.

This is essentially an opt-out too: even if I, as in my example, group initialization methods together, where do I put that group, before or after public methods?

Note this doesn't answer my question.
